title: How to Make Pan Fried Turbot

steps.headline: Shake a little salt and pepper on both sides of the fillets.
steps.description: Dip the fillets in a bowl of flour and try to shake off any excess flour.

steps.headline: Oil and heat a pan over medium heat and lay the fish fillets in the pan.
steps.description: Fry each fillet side for 2 minutes, more or less time due to the thickness and size of each one.

steps.headline: Remove the fish from the pan and discard the oil in a bowl.
steps.description: Use a paper towel and wipe the frying pan.

steps.headline: Add the butter to the heated pan to foam up.
steps.description: Cook the tomatoes with lemon juice and a dash of salt and pepper for a few seconds. Remove the mixture from the heat. Add the chopped parsley on top and give it a small stir.

steps.headline: Serve the fish fillets on plates.
steps.description: Scoop a good serving of the tomato mixture and place it on the top of the fish.

text: Shake a little salt and pepper on both sides of the fillets. Dip the fillets in a bowl of flour and try to shake off any excess flour. Oil and heat a pan over medium heat and lay the fish fillets in the pan. Fry each fillet side for 2 minutes, more or less time due to the thickness and size of each one. Remove the fish from the pan and discard the oil in a bowl. Use a paper towel and wipe the frying pan. Add the butter to the heated pan to foam up. Cook the tomatoes with lemon juice and a dash of salt and pepper for a few seconds. Remove the mixture from the heat. Add the chopped parsley on top and give it a small stir. Serve the fish fillets on plates. Scoop a good serving of the tomato mixture and place it on the top of the fish.
